result.execSummary:
The defendant NATHANIEL RALPH EDWIN ADELMAN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
PAYABLE TO CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE - 30 days to pay or request a payment plan. 
Bond applied. Paid in Full. 
All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
01:59 PM - Recalled-  Defendant NATHANIEL RALPH EDWIN ADELMAN in court with Attorney Roger M Hillestad.  Scott Zehr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant informed of charges and penalties.  
Defendant Advised of Constitutional Rights.  
Acknowledges prior conviction(s)
Defendant enters no contest plea. (w/ repeater)
Factual basis and probable cause found.  
Court accepts pleas as voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently made and finds defendant guilty.

Court orders:
$50 fine + costs= $616
DNA
Bond to be applied- remainder to return to poster

01:49 PM Defendant NATHANIEL RALPH EDWIN ADELMAN in court with Attorney Roger M Hillestad.  Scott Zehr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant will accept offer. To be recalled when paperwork is completed.

Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons. 
No verbal or physical abuse of anyone.

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on March 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

$2000 CASH BOND AMENDED TO $1000 CASH BOND 
Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons. 
No verbal or physical abuse of anyone.
No contact with Victim 1. Victim 1's family, or Victim 1's residence.

Attorney Harless requests to modify the cash bond to a signature bond. 
ADA Broeren requests to address bond modification outside of intake. 
Court adjusts bond to $1000 to reflect the maximum penalty of a misdemeanor.

01:42 PM Defendant NATHANIEL RALPH EDWIN ADELMAN in court with Attorney Kirby Daniel Harless.  Defendant NATHANIEL RALPH EDWIN ADELMAN in custody.  Sara Matthews appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NATHANIEL RALPH EDWIN ADELMAN appeared by video means.
Attorney Harless as a friend of the Court for today's purposes only. 
Attorney waives reading of complaint. 
Defendant is informed of charges. 
Defendant received copy of Criminal Complaint.
Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 01:45 pm.  Review hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
